page.title: 08LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our area consists mainly of a small village, a school and the rest of the area consists of farms. Babcary is a small village with a few houses, a pub, a church, a Post Office and not much else as there is no mains drainage at the moment. A few people live at Hazlegrove House School permanently, but most live elsewhere during the holidays. Many of the farms are tenanted by a group of tenants and are close together. Our area is about a hundred metres above sea level and is fairly flat on the whole,except in the south-east and the north-west. In the south-east a hill gently rises and Hazlegrove is here, and in the north-west a hill rises more sharply and Babcary is here.
